segments.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Presents, just a trivial little broach.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, I remember it well, bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No it wasn't. It was very pretty I still have it and I wear it often.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No I didn't, you worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must admit he was in love with you, wasn't he?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You let him kiss you; you said you did.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It gave him a lot of pleasure, it didn't hurt me any.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, if you hadn't been so nosey and suspicious you never wouldn't have known anything about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's a nice point of view I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm bored of this conversation.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, me too, bored stiff. You want some Brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No thanks.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I have a little I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't see why you want any you've already had two glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No particular reason. Anyhow, they are very small ones.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It just seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in a whole evening going on and on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, it's become a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You needn't be so grand just because don't happen want any yourself right now.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't be so stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really, Amanda.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nothing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No I'm just making myself fascinating for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Going out somewhere, dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's a woman's job to allure the man
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: watch me a minute, will you?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, no it isn't.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes it is.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Be quiet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's a pity you didn't have any more Brandy it might have made you a little less disagreeable.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It doesn't seem to work such wonders with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Adders don't snap they sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh nonsense they have a little bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't care. Do you understand? I don't care. I don't care if they bark or roll about like hoops.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Tell me, did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I did quite a lot.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I imagine you let him kiss you good deal more then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mind your own business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What riotous time you must have had.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No restraint at all, very enjoyable, never had much anyhow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're quite insufferable. I expect it's because you're drunk.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I am not in the least drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I imagine, as I may have already mentioned, I've had three minute liquor glasses of Brandy the whole evening long a child of two couldn't get drunk on that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: On the contrary a child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass of Brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh very interesting. How about a child of four, a child of six or a child of nine?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh be quiet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We can get a good little debate going about that, don't you think? Intemperate tots.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not very funny my dear, you better have some more Brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: All right. I will.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Better turn that off I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Because it's late and it'll annoy the people upstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There aren't any people upstairs it's a photographer's studio.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: There are people downstairs I suppose?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They're away in Tunis.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: This is no time of the year for Tunis.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on again, please.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll do no such thing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Very well, if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off it's driving me mad.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You are far too temperamental. Try to control yourself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Stop it. Stop it. I hate you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Amanda, listen. Listen.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Listen indeed. I'm sick and tired of listening to you, damn sadistic bully.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Very amusing indeed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Stop it. Stop it. I hate you, do you hear? You're overbearing and conceited and utterly impossible.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're a vile tempered, loose living, wicked little beast and I hope I never see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is the end, do you hear? The end finally and forever.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not going like this.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh yes I am.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I am. Let go of me you're cruel fiend and I hate and loathe you. Thank God I realized who you really are before I would ever, ever marry you again. I would never marry you again. I'd rather die in torment.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Shut up.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Shut up.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I wouldn't marry you again if you came to me on your bended knees. You're a evil minded little vampire. I hope to God I never see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're a beast. I hate you. Stop it. Stop it.
segments.speaker: F
